newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Clariant 1996 profit rises exceeds 14 pct.
newsitem.headline: Clariant 1996 profit rises exceeds 14 pct.

text.p: Swiss chemicals group Clariant AG said it expected the rise in net profit for 1996 to exceed the 14 percent reported for the first half of the year.
Referring to the first half profit increase of 14 percent, a Clariant spokesman said there had been many improvements during the second half, including in profits.
Asked whether this meant that profits would exceed the 14 percent rise, the spokesman said "yes."
Earlier today Clariant reported that 1996 sales rose nine percent to 2.337 billion francs and repeated its forecast for earnings to show a double-digit increase.
In the first half of 1996 Clariant's rose 14 percent to 64 million francs.
